gui

Interface State

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultState, StateGenerating, StatePlaying, StateTitle, StateWinning

    public interface State
    The state interface is used for the controller such that all states of the UI conform and can be treated the same way.
    Author:
    Peter Kemper

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean keyDown(Constants.UserInput key, int value)
      Provides input the user has given with the keyboard.
      void setBuilder(Order.Builder dfs)
      Sets the builder algorithm that should be used to generate a maze
      void setFileName(java.lang.String filename)
      Sets the filename that is used to load a maze from
      void setMazeConfiguration(MazeConfiguration config)
      Sets the maze to play, the maze configuration is a container that holds all necessary information about a particular maze that can be played.
      void setPathLength(int pathLength)
      Sets the length of the path that one has passed through the maze, typically of interest for the final screen.
      void setPerfect(boolean isPerfect)
      Specifies if the maze that should be generated must be perfect, i.e., it does not have cycles, which is achieved by not(!) allowing for rooms.
      void setSkillLevel(int skillLevel)
      Sets the skill level to determine the size of maze that should be generated.
      void start(Controller controller, MazePanel panel)
      Starts the main operation of to be performed in this state.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        void start(Controller controller,
           MazePanel panel)
        Starts the main operation of to be performed in this state. Semantics depends on the particular state implementing it. This is polymorphism in action.
        Parameters:
        controller - is a reference to the current controller
        panel - is the panel to draw graphics on

      • setFileName

        void setFileName(java.lang.String filename)
        Sets the filename that is used to load a maze from
        Parameters:
        filename - for a maze

      • setSkillLevel

        void setSkillLevel(int skillLevel)
        Sets the skill level to determine the size of maze that should be generated.
        Parameters:
        skillLevel - for the size of the maze

      • setMazeConfiguration

        void setMazeConfiguration(MazeConfiguration config)
        Sets the maze to play, the maze configuration is a container that holds all necessary information about a particular maze that can be played. It is the outcome of the maze generation process performed in the maze factory.
        Parameters:
        config - gives a maze to play

      • setPathLength

        void setPathLength(int pathLength)
        Sets the length of the path that one has passed through the maze, typically of interest for the final screen.
        Parameters:
        pathLength - walked through the maze

      • keyDown

        boolean keyDown(Constants.UserInput key,
                int value)
        Provides input the user has given with the keyboard. The SimpleKeyListener maps input into UserInput and filters out invalid input.
        Parameters:
        key - input from Enum set of legal commands
        value - carries a value, typically the skill level, optional
        Returns:

      • setBuilder

        void setBuilder(Order.Builder dfs)
        Sets the builder algorithm that should be used to generate a maze
        Parameters:
        dfs - specifies the algorithm, e.g. depth-first-search

      • setPerfect

        void setPerfect(boolean isPerfect)
        Specifies if the maze that should be generated must be perfect, i.e., it does not have cycles, which is achieved by not(!) allowing for rooms. A maze that is not perfect can contain cycles. Cycles are often a byproduct of the presence of rooms.
        Parameters:
        isPerfect - is true if maze must be perfect, false otherwise
